metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2271 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
VMX in Xen 4.6.x and earlier, when using an Intel or Cyrix CPU, allowslocal HVM guest users to cause a denial of service (guest crash) viavectors related to a non-canonical RIP.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2271` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-system-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-utils-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-utils-common - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xenstore-utils - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5').
